author: Joanne Chiu
title: Asia-Pacific Stocks Start the Week With a Whimper
text:
The S&P 500 was largely unchanged Monday, as a stock-market rally that once appeared unstoppable entered its longest stretch of vulnerability since the financial crisis.
The broad index of 500 companies shifted between small gains and losses for most of the session. The S&P 500’s increase of less than 0.1% Monday marked the 51st trading day since the index suffered a correction—a decline of at least 10% from a recent high—its longest stretch in correction territory since 2008.
